source_caption_data.pre_caption: This video shows a quiet residential street in Japan on a sunny day. There are houses on either side of the road, with cars parked in driveways. The camera moves slowly down the street.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This video shows a quiet residential street in Japan on a sunny day. There are houses on either side of the road, with cars parked in driveways. The camera moves slowly down the street.

generated_critique: The caption accurately identifies the scene but could be more concise and better integrate the description of the motion. The first and last sentences are somewhat redundant. Instead of describing the scene and the camera's movement separately, combine them into a single, more descriptive sentence. For example, state that the camera moves forward along a quiet residential street, which incorporates both the action and the setting in a more fluid and concise manner.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: The camera moves forward along a quiet residential street in Japan on a sunny day, passing houses on both sides and cars parked in driveways.
